intro: Crambe edentula, commonly known as the toothless crambe, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a distinctive lack of teeth along the margins. Crambe edentula is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
